content.body:
Here are my slides on the non-binding Intl Era Month Code Stage 2 Update: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1wvJoRFa8nRjlYSHuVLpxx-wCfwt4H9NIw2fsGJ72gxs/edit#slide=id.p

content.formatted_body:
Here are my slides on the non-binding Intl Era Month Code Stage 2 Update: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1wvJoRFa8nRjlYSHuVLpxx-wCfwt4H9NIw2fsGJ72gxs/edit#slide=id.p

content.body: Thanks. I've noted slides 8 and 9 for Gecko patch review purposes.
sffc: On slide 9 you have `new Intl.DateTimeFormat('und-SA', ...)`, but AFAIK no runtime does anything with the region there. Is that intentional?
content.formatted_body: sffc: On slide 9 you have new Intl.DateTimeFormat('und-SA', ...), but AFAIK no runtime does anything with the region there. Is that intentional?

content.body: Though `Intl.Locale` does maximise that to `ar-Arab-SA`. For a locale tag like that, that does feel like it'd be closer to what the user wanted in this case.
content.formatted_body: Though Intl.Locale does maximise that to ar-Arab-SA. For a locale tag like that, that does feel like it'd be closer to what the user wanted in this case.

content.body: Actually, should we consider a new `localeMatcher` option value that did apply maximization to the selected locale? Or is that something that's technically already allowed with `"best fit"` locale matching?
content.formatted_body: Actually, should we consider a new localeMatcher option value that did apply maximization to the selected locale? Or is that something that's technically already allowed with "best fit" locale matching?
